Method Detail

resolve

java.net.InetAddress resolve(java.lang.String hostname)
                             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException
Resolve any hostname. This is just a bridge to InetAddress.getByName(String). What it can do is be used to check for differences in nslookup behavior across systems. Though when that is happening, things may be going so badly that RMI itself can collapse.

Parameters:
hostname - host to resolve
Returns:
the resolved hostname
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - if it does not resolve
java.rmi.RemoteException - for RMI problems

hostExists

boolean hostExists(java.lang.String hostname)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Resolve any hostname. This is just a bridge to InetAddress.getByName(String). What it can do is be used to check for differences in nslookup behavior across systems. Though when that is happening, things may be going so badly that RMI itself can collapse.

Parameters:
hostname - host to resolve
Returns:
true iff the host exists as far as this process is concerned.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - for RMI problems
